discourse_list.title: What is MakerDAO doing to help DAI reach the peg?

content.content: I see that there are lots of initiatives going on (compensations, MIPs, ranked choice voting…) but noone seems to care about the peg. Maybe someone at MakerDAO is working on a solution to bring DAI back to the peg - I’m not aware of it. My question is: Is there any short-term parameter/measure/action that can be taken to bring DAI back to $1.00? If there is none, then this system’s design has to be improved. If the only measure left is to lower the SF to 0, then MakerDAO should “encourage” that vote in the same way as it is “encouraging” lowering the DC, adding USDC as collateral etc. If there is no direct way to influence the peg at this time, then the DAI users and the community can be informed more directly (a blog/reddit post?) about that so that they can make more informed choice about buying/using/trading DAI. From the last governance meeting (@Vishesh):  It’s still locked into that inverse pattern. Which tells me the peg is not yet ready to let go of its correlation to ETH. When that decoupling happens, which I’m reasonably confident it will at some point, that’s when you’ll see it return to a Dollar. We’re not quite there yet and you can’t rush that return to peg. It would be difficult.  Since lowering the SF is not mentioned -  does that mean that we can just wait (“not rushing it”) and hope? If I don’t get new insights here that could change my mind, I’ll start a signal vote for the on-chain poll with the question: “Lower the SF to 0 (yes/no)”. In the “Review” section the explanation (arguments for/against) will be given in the same way as it is done for the Vault Compensation Poll (https://vote.makerdao.com/polling-proposal/qmwfvvguaf8rz8xwgv2cqnzzt9t5h6epzh17qmk2ue99y4). If you don’t think it’s a good idea to lower the SF to 0, please write here and I’ll add that info to the “Arguments against” section.
